org.jboss.windup.config.parser

Class ParserContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jboss.windup.config.parser.ParserContext

  • public class ParserContext
extends Object
    Handles maintaining the list of handlers associated with each tag/namespace pair, as well as selecting the right handler for element. This also maintains the current RuleProviderBuilder being constructed.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ParserContext(org.jboss.forge.furnace.Furnace furnace, RuleLoaderContext ruleLoaderContext)
      Initialize tag handlers based upon the provided furnace instance.

      • setXmlInputRootPath

        public void setXmlInputRootPath(Path xmlRootInputPath)
        The folder containing the xml file currently being parsed. This should be the root folder from which any other resource lookups should be based. Eg, it may be the user scripts folder. If this is set, it should take precedent over the Addon for resource lookups.

      • getXmlInputRootPath

        public Path getXmlInputRootPath()
        The folder containing the xml file currently being parsed. This should be the root folder from which any other resource lookups should be based. Eg, it may be the user scripts folder. If this is set, it should take precedent over the Addon for resource lookups.

      • getRuleLoaderContext

        public RuleLoaderContext getRuleLoaderContext()
        Get access to rule loader information (paths, context variables, etc).
